binary.name: rtmultiplex
binary.syntax: rtmultiplex [-vb] [-t timeout] [-L logname] [-T timename] [-pf portname] [-if pidname] [-lp lport] [-f] hostnames... rports...

option.od: print the help message and exit.
print the RST version number and exit.
verbose. Log information to the console.
reset the connection if no packets are received in timeout seconds. By default, the timeout is 20 seconds.
log connections and information in the file logname. By default, connections are recorded in log.rt.
log the time that the last packet was received in the file timename. By default, the time is recorded in time.rt.
record the port number that the server is listening for connections on in the file portname. By default, the port is recorded in port.id.
record the process Identifier (PID) of the server in the file pidname. By default, the PID is recorded in pid.id.
force the server to listen on the local port number port. By default, the server requests a port number from the Operating System.
allow stream filtering. Each data stream is assigned a numeric identifier.
space separated hostnames or IP numbers of the systems to connect to.
space separated list of port numbers to connect to on the servers.

description.p: The task acts as both server and client attaching to multiple remote hosts and multiplexing the data streams together into a single stream that is relayed to the client tasks.

Each remote data stream is assigned a stream number based on the position that the server name appears in the command line. The clients connecting to the rtmultiplex task can select the stream they wish to receive by sending a single byte back to the server.

example.description: Connects to the remote host peanut.jhuapl.edu at port 1024, and to host almond.jhuapl.edu at port 1024. Relay data from a port allocated by the operating system. The port number is recorded in the file "port.id" and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.rt".

Connects to the remote host peanut.jhuapl.edu at ports 1200 and 1201. Relay data from the port 5000. The port number is recorded in the file "port.id" and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.rt".
